definition: to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise

sentences.english: The marketplace is noisy and dirty.
sentences.chinese: 这个市场既吵杂又脏乱。

sentences.english: We also enjoy making loud noise with firecrackers!
sentences.chinese: 我们也喜欢伴随著吵杂的声音燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: I can't do with loud music.
sentences.chinese: 我无法忍受吵杂的音乐。

sentences.english: Noisy white were flying over her head as well.
sentences.chinese: 吵杂的白色也从她的头上飞过。

sentences.english: Can I drink a cup of noise without tea?
sentences.chinese: 我能否饮下一杯吵杂而没有茶？

sentences.english: Ex. Peter is a pleasant if noisy child.
sentences.chinese: 虽然吵杂点，但比特还算是有趣的孩子。

sentences.english: Newsboys were known for being loud and intrusive, much like the Scout.
sentences.chinese: 和侦察兵一样，报童常常被视为是吵杂的嗨咖。

sentences.english: It's so noisy that I can't concentrate on my work.
sentences.chinese: 如此吵杂以至于我无法专心在工作上。

sentences.english: Talking on your mobile phone in a noisy place can be difficult.
sentences.chinese: 在吵杂的地方用手机讲话可能是困难的。

sentences.english: The last time we went out, Tyler said the loud music made him constipated.
sentences.chinese: 我们上次去舞厅后泰勒说吵杂的音乐让他得了便秘。

sentences.english: As soon as we are alone, …inner chaos opens up in us.
sentences.chinese: 我们一旦孤独，内心便开始吵杂。

sentences.english: Clutching his ears to sleep, outside noisy world has nothing to do with me.
sentences.chinese: 捂着耳朵继续睡，外面吵杂的世界与我无关。
我想去一家不会吵杂的餐厅。

sentences.english: I don't mind loud music once in a while, but enough is enough.
sentences.chinese: 我偶尔还可以忍受吵杂的音乐，但是请适可而止。

sentences.english: His hobbies include begging and attacking noisy appliances.
sentences.chinese: 兴趣包括乞讨与攻击吵杂器具。

sentences.english: Everything seems very loud and strange.
sentences.chinese: 一切都显得很吵杂和陌生。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
